tweet:
Despite this success, the Administration has proposed a new rule that will take food out of the mouths of millions of people. 

This proposal will hurt seniors and families who rely on SNAP to put food on the table. #HandsOffSNAP

Today marks the 55th anniversary of President Lyndon B. Johnson signing the Food Stamp Act into law.  Today, SNAP is the country's most effective anti-hunger program, feeding nearly 40 million Americans in 2018.

In July, I was proud to support legislation to #RaiseTheWage.  The bill would gradually increase the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour by 2025, lift over one million people out of poverty, and give nearly 33 million Americans the stability they deserve.  #LaborDay2019 https://twitter.com/EdLaborCmte/status/1167442239502651393 …

Having a sufficient number of trained emergency responders ensures the safety of our communities.  Join @AkronOhioMayor and the Akron Fire Department on Sept. 12 for the dedication of two new fire stations in #Akron.  

For more information: https://bit.ly/2HskZs1

#OTD 56 years ago, over 200,000 people gathered for the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom.  On this anniversary, let us continue to fight for jobs, justice, equality, and voting rights so we can someday fulfill Dr. King’s dream. pic.twitter.com/1unFuaZ3cz

Vaccines are a safe and effective way to protect against preventable diseases.  As National Immunization Awareness Month comes to a close this week, remember to take time to make sure you and your family are up-to-date on your immunizations.  https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/schedules/ … pic.twitter.com/IGynHKU5kG

#DidYouKnow: Cleveland welcomed a record 19.2 million visitors in 2018, the eighth year in a row the city’s visitor growth has outperformed the rest of the United States. #ThisisCLE https://www.cleveland.com/business/2019/08/greater-cleveland-attracted-a-record-192-million-visitors-in-2018-outpacing-ohio-and-us-growth.html …

On August 26, 1920, the 19th Amendment became law, guaranteeing women the right to vote.  As we celebrate #WomensEqualityDay and 99 years of progress today, let’s continue to work toward true equality by ensuring every American has the unfettered and unabridged right to vote. pic.twitter.com/OazUHj20OL
Wishing all students and educators in OH-11 a successful school year as our young scholars return #BackToSchool throughout this month! pic.twitter.com/bpdAHPaa9G

We’ve seen the impacts of climate change on our region. Extreme weather also affects the health of children in the state of Ohio and across the country. It’s time to take action to reduce emissions and protect the safety & well-being of future generations https://www.dispatch.com/news/20190822/report-climate-change-hazardous-to-health-of-ohio-children …

There's only one way to challenge pay discrimination: change the law.  Earlier this year, the House passed the #PaycheckFairness Act, an important first step towards ensuring that Black women are paid fairly for their work. #PayBlackWomen pic.twitter.com/Siqjh37IXm

This wage gap hurts Black women & damages the economic security of Black families.  It's time for Congress to take concrete action to strengthen #equalpay protections and combat discriminatory pay practices. #BlackWomenCantWait for #PaycheckFairness

Black women working full-time, year-round earned only 61 cents for every dollar earned by white, non-Hispanic men in 2017.  Due to this wage gap, black women stand to lose nearly $1 million over a 40-year career. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/22/heres-how-the-gender-wage-gap-affects-this-minority-group.html …

Today, on #BlackWomensEqualPay Day, let us recognize Black women’s contributions to their families, their communities, and the economy, and support efforts to #PayBlackWomen. pic.twitter.com/lZQKrGMHa4

Our seniors remain a vital part of our communities and deserve our respect and appreciation.  On #SeniorCitizensDay and every day, let us honor older Americans and the contributions they make to our communities. pic.twitter.com/gCiMF6baAS

.@USDA hasn’t adequately explained why it is moving ERS & NIFA to Kansas City. Now there are reports that the department is reducing its commitments to employees who do not relocate. This decision unfairly penalizes staff & further undermines the research these agencies conduct. https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1163891722054770688 …

In February, @HouseDemocrats acted to end gun violence and passed #HR8 and #HR1112. It’s been 175 days and the Senate has done nothing. My message to my colleagues in the @SenateGOP is simple: #DoSomething. pic.twitter.com/IypjG2mcS0

On this 400th anniversary of the first arrival of enslaved people to America’s shores, the @nytmag’s #1619Project tells the story often left out of history books. It is a must read & an important reminder of the contributions, struggles and resiliency of African American people. https://twitter.com/NYTmag/status/1161613183804739585 …

It’s been seven years since President Obama implemented #DACA. Today, hundreds of thousands of our neighbors, colleagues and friends are at risk of losing their legal status in the US. I’m fighting to #ProtectTheDream for all #DACA #TPS and #DED recipients. pic.twitter.com/OKTIoCvsfp

The Israeli government’s unprecedented move to bar Members of the U.S. Congress from its country is shocking & shameful. Democratic governments tolerate, not censure, differing ideologies & political views. I urge Israel to reverse its decision!

Congrats to the University of Akron for selecting its 18th President, Dr. Gary L. Miller!  I look forward to working with Dr. Miller as he leads UA into the future. https://twitter.com/uakron/status/1161659950214602752 …
Americans deserve the peace of mind of knowing the benefits they earned over a lifetime of working will be there when they need them. #SocSec84 pic.twitter.com/2BRclcrkQI

Bankruptcy rates among seniors have tripled since 1991 because of lost savings and higher medical costs.  We must protect and expand Social Security now more than ever. #SocSec84 pic.twitter.com/kAvmzh4Klu

“This rule is un-American, immoral and unnecessary. This is just another bigoted attempt by this President to marginalize immigrants, the poor and people of color.” To read my full statement about the final public charge rule, visit:  https://bit.ly/2H3gq6W . https://twitter.com/EdLaborCmte/status/1160984342618869761 …

"The library helps you to see, not only that you are not alone, but that you’re not really any different from everyone else." - Maya Angelou.  This #BookLoversDay, I encourage you to visit your local library & explore the many resources it has to offer you. pic.twitter.com/ere2tKISgh

Local farmers markets are a great way to fill a gap in nutrition. They provide access to various types of healthy, fresh & nutritious foods at an affordable price. To find a farmers market near you & one that accepts SNAP, visit:  https://bit.ly/2aLnZC8 . pic.twitter.com/U7ttKgplSv

Today marks the 54th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act of 1965. OTD, we remember the sacrifices made and blood shed by the brave men and women who fought for our right to vote. Let us honor their legacy by being engaged and staying engaged. #OurVoteIsOurVoice pic.twitter.com/pYwiQGZZBz

The passing of Ohio native and Nobel laureate Toni Morrison is heartbreaking. Her novels broke barriers and opened the eyes of the world to the African American experience. Her enduring legacy will impact aspiring writers, avid readers and the entire country for years to come. pic.twitter.com/izgeQiD0MC

The @senatemajldr refuses to bring sensible gun reform legislation to the Senate floor. We have done our part, now it is his turn.  End the #McConnellGraveyard NOW! https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/1158416137027227649 …
@rockettherapist The House has already passed bipartisan background checks bills (H.R 8 and H.R. 1112). Sadly, Senate inaction has delayed progress.

We must also pray for the safety of our country. It is beyond time for our leaders to do what is necessary to enact laws that keep guns out of the hands of people wishing to do harm. This has to stop. #EnoughIsEnough #EndGunViolence

My heart is heavy after hearing the news of another shooting, this time in Dayton, Ohio - 13 hours following the El Paso shooting that robbed 20 innocent people of their lives. Sending prayers to the victims, their families, law enforcement and the entire Dayton community.

Thank you to all OH-11 residents and local elected officials in attendance at today’s town hall meeting. I appreciate hearing your questions and concerns. Missed the town hall? Visit  http://www.fudge.house.gov  to obtain the resource materials distributed during the meeting. pic.twitter.com/HP7RB3oJTh
As authorities continue to provide updates regarding today’s shooting in Texas, our prayers remain with the victims, injured persons, their families and the entire El Paso community.

While in Ghana, we had the opportunity to meet with Ghanaian President Nana Akufo-Addo, Speaker Mike Oquaye and other senior government officials. It was also humbling, to visit the W.E.B. Du Bois Center in Accra and lay flowers at his final resting place. pic.twitter.com/Q1Z6XNWJbj

Visiting Elmina Castle and the “Door of No Return” was a moving & powerful experience. To stand in the space where many of our ancestors took their last glimpse of Africa is a reminder of why we continue to defend the freedoms we have today. pic.twitter.com/CS0mB9BigQ

It was an honor to join @SpeakerPelosi  and Members of @TheBlackCaucus in traveling to Ghana to mark “The Year of Return” and the 400th anniversary of the arrival of the first enslaved Africans to American shores. pic.twitter.com/DBo5bvNVNp
